ValueDomain.preferredName: PCORnet CDM Diagnosis Related Group Version Code

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A system developed by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to classify hospital cases into diagnosis-related groups to facilitate Medicare reimbursement. Compared to the CMS-DRG, the MS-DRG adds 300 diagnosis-related groups and factors in the severity of illness for establishing reimbursement levels.

Concepts.definition: A system developed by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to classify hospital cases into diagnosis-related groups to facilitate Medicare reimbursement. Compared to the CMS-DRG, the MS-DRG adds 300 diagnosis-related groups and factors in the severity of illness for establishing reimbursement levels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A system developed by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to classify hospital cases into diagnosis-related groups to facilitate Medicare reimbursement. This system was used until 2007.

Concepts.longName: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services System for Diagnosis-Related Groups
Concepts.definition: A system developed by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to classify hospital cases into diagnosis-related groups to facilitate Medicare reimbursement. This system was used until 2007.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.
